title: Pinging VO lines
body: so with this feature being added onto Rakan and Xayah, could Riot consider adding this as a general element to upcoming champion releases and updates? Since there's a feature to mute players' pings when they get spammy, I can't see people being able to abuse the VO to just become obnoxious, and having some audio feedback to what's being pinged other than just "ping pong poong" could provide more helpful information to the players about what's going on. (ie: I hear midlane say "hey where'd he go" and I back up and check my wards for an incoming gank.)

replies.body: Hey, thanks for bring up the conversation! Ping VO is something we definitely wanted to experiment with in general for League. Xayah & Rakan's relationship provided the best opportunity to see how Ping VO could add to the experience of ADC's and Supports coordinating with each other in bot lane. Keep the feedback a-coming! :)

Are there any plans for the ping VOs to happen even if both of them aren't in the game?

Hey OverpoweredSoap! We currently don't have plans to have Ping VO on if either Xayah or Rakan are not in a game together. They were designed this way to reinforce their relationship and add to their experience of coordination during a game.
I love the random chit chat back and forth that sounds like it's over walkie-talkie. So far I haven't played them enough to get a feeling of the pinging
I can't wait for Swain to be all tactical with his ping commands.
I remember Dawngate having this. Nothing better than throwing a warning ping at someone and Kahgen yelling out "Heads up, dumbass."

I would love it if all the champions had ping VOs.
And ward VOs.
